page.title: 02The Dymchurch Landscape
page.content: From the school window The glimmering of ripening corn, Farm buildings stand out Among potato fields of bushy green And pasture trodden by Romney Marsh sheep. The hazy background matches the dull grey sky: I imagine Roman troops marching along the grassy hills Towards the stone blocks that were once their port. A solitary car drives between a patch- work of fields, Puffs of smoke from the miniature train, Gleaming red through the trees. Stubby thorn bushes line the dykes, Shy moorhens hide in the reeds, A heron swoops to grab a fish. The Marsh has a mind of its own - A mystic mind.
